TITLE: Installing @dnd-kit-svelte/sortable Package DESCRIPTION: Command for installing the @dnd-kit-svelte/sortable package via npm. This is the primary package needed to implement drag and drop sortable functionality in Svelte applications. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/packages/sortable/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install @dnd-kit-svelte/sortable ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing dnd-kit-svelte using Package Managers (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to install the `@dnd-kit-svelte/core` package using the npm, yarn, or pnpm package managers. These commands add the core library dependency to your Svelte project. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Bash CODE: ``` npm i @dnd-kit-svelte/core # or yarn add @dnd-kit-svelte/core # or pnpm add @dnd-kit-svelte/core ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Reactive Data in useSortable Hook (React vs Svelte) DESCRIPTION: Compares passing reactive data to the `useSortable` hook in React (`@dnd-kit/sortable`) and Svelte (`@dnd-kit-svelte/sortable`). In Svelte, reactive variables intended for fields like `data` must be passed via a function (`() => item`) to ensure the hook always reads the latest value, unlike in React where the value can be passed directly. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` // React dnd-kit import {useSortable} from '@dnd-kit/sortable'; useSortable({ id: item.id, data: item, }); // Svelte dnd-kit import {useSortable} from '@dnd-kit-svelte/sortable'; useSortable({ // Static value id: item.id, // Reactive value using a function data: () => item, // Access reactive state value }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Hook Return Values (React vs Svelte) DESCRIPTION: Shows the difference in accessing non-function properties returned by `dnd-kit` hooks (like `useSortable`) between React and Svelte. In Svelte, properties like `attributes`, `listeners`, and state (`isDragging`) must be accessed using a `.current` getter (`attributes.current`, `listeners.current`, `isDragging.current`) within the template or component logic. This is necessary because Svelte components do not re-render in the same way as React components when state changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: TypeScript CODE: ``` // React dnd-kit const { attributes, listeners, isDragging } = useSortable({ id });
{isDragging ? 'Dragging' : 'Not dragging'}
// Svelte dnd-kit const { attributes, listeners, isDragging } = useSortable({ id });
{isDragging.current ? 'Dragging' : 'Not dragging'}
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing @dnd-kit-svelte/utilities with npm DESCRIPTION: This command installs the `@dnd-kit-svelte/utilities` package using npm. It's a prerequisite for using the utilities provided by the package in a Svelte project that utilizes the `@dnd-kit` library for drag and drop functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/packages/utilities/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install @dnd-kit-svelte/utilities ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing @dnd-kit-svelte/modifiers with npm DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides the npm command to install the @dnd-kit-svelte/modifiers package, which enhances drag and drop experiences in Svelte applications using @dnd-kit. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/packages/modifiers/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install @dnd-kit-svelte/modifiers ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing @dnd-kit-svelte/accessibility with npm DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to install the @dnd-kit-svelte/accessibility package using the npm package manager. It adds the package as a project dependency. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/packages/accessibility/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install @dnd-kit-svelte/accessibility ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Project with sv CLI (Bash) DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to create a new Svelte project using the `npx sv create` command. The first command initializes a project in the current directory, while the second creates it in a specified sub-directory (my-app). This requires Node.js and the sv CLI to be available. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/sites/docs/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # create a new project in the current directory npx sv create # create a new project in my-app npx sv create my-app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Production App (npm/Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command compiles the Svelte application into a production-ready version. The output is optimized for performance and deployment. Running this command is a prerequisite for testing the production build or deploying the application. Requires project dependencies to be installed (`npm install`). SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/sites/docs/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Development Server (npm/Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command starts a local development server for the Svelte project. The first variant runs the server, typically accessible via a browser. The second variant includes the `--open` flag to automatically open the application in a new browser tab upon startup. Requires project dependencies to be installed (`npm install`). SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/sites/docs/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run dev # or start the server and open the app in a new browser tab npm run dev -- --open ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Previewing Production Build (npm/Bash) DESCRIPTION: This command allows you to locally preview the application after it has been built for production using `npm run build`. It starts a small server to serve the production assets, enabling testing of the optimized output before actual deployment. Requires running `npm run build` first. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanielu/dnd-kit-svelte/blob/main/sites/docs/README.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run preview ```
